hotels.name: Salil Hotel Sukhumvit Soi 11
hotels.address: 19 Sukhumvit Soi 11, Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Bangkok 10110
hotels.summary: Sukhumvit Soi 11 is Bangkok's party central - packed with rooftop bars, international restaurants, and nightclubs. The BTS Nana station is a 5-min walk, making the whole city accessible. Great for first-night energy before heading south.

hotels.name: Lipe Beach Resort
hotels.summary: Thailand's southernmost paradise near the Malaysian border. Tiny island with three beaches, no cars, and a backpacker vibe. Walking Street connects Pattaya and Sunrise beaches with bars, restaurants, and shops. Crystal clear water for snorkeling right off the beach.

hotels.name: Le Dugong Libong Beach Resort
hotels.summary: Off-the-beaten-path island famous for dugong (sea cow) sightings in the seagrass beds. A Muslim fishing community with zero nightlife - just beaches, mangroves, and incredible wildlife. The ultimate digital detox before the livelier islands.

hotels.name: Kradan Beach Resort
hotels.summary: The 'Maldives of Thailand' - a tiny car-free island with powder white sand and turquoise water. Just a few resorts, no village, no ATMs. Snorkel straight off Paradise Beach to see incredible coral. Day trips to Emerald Cave on nearby Koh Mook.

hotels.name: Relax Bay Beach Resort
hotels.summary: The largest island on the trip with proper roads, scooter rentals, and a chill reggae vibe. Long Beach has the bars and restaurants, Old Town has historic stilt houses and cafes. Best diving access to Hin Daeng/Hin Muang - Thailand's top sites.

hotels.name: Casa Vimaya Riverside
hotels.address: 226/5 Soi Wat Rakang, Arunamarin Rd, Bangkok Noi, Bangkok 10700

weather.desc: End of dry season, warm evenings

hotels.summary: Riverside boutique hotel in the historic Rattanakosin area, a boat ride from Wat Arun and the Grand Palace. Perfect final night location - sunset drinks on the river, Chinatown street food nearby, then straight to the airport for the flight home.
